item.title: Popehat
item.description:
There are two elements to the immunity decision that are particularly extreme in a way that many will miss: (1) motive is irrelevant and (2) immune acts are not just excluded from prosecution, they‚Äôre excluded from evidence.
/1

item.title: Popehat
item.description: /8 At any rate, congratulations to the Federalist Society for an achievement beyond the reach of the British, outside the grasp of bloody civil war, impossible to Nazis and Soviets and terrorists: defeating the American idea.

item.title: Dan Gillmor
item.description: Our corrupt Supreme Court didn't authorize an absolute, hereditary monarchy, so the "king" stuff isn't quite right. It did, however, clear the way for a dictatorship.

item.title: Popehat
item.description:
I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs an exaggeration at all to say the decision threatens the Republic. I might not have said so in 2015, before I saw how triumphantly lawless and autocratic the President could be, and how so many people would applaud it or at least shrug.

RE: https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:oaghntcihvzqkirfcn4faarb/post/3kwawozaxtm2f

Wrong‚Äô‚Äù"Despite the compelling case for goodness, truth, and justice made by our predecessors in the case of Right v. Wrong, we firmly believe that malice, dishonesty, and injustice were the framers' original intent."https://www.theonion.com/supreme-court-overturns-right-v-wrong-1819573211#SCOTUS #CanPoundSand

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description:
Quite a bit on display in this PubPeer thread :- ImageTwin has come of age
- Maybe every image duplication ever will now be found and posted...
- It seems that papermills have been operating peacefully for quite a while
- That particular journal is surely going to be in the news at some pointhttps://pubpeer.com/publications/3EEEA186814EA175B17E02EC9C886B#

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
Posted a book review that turned into more of an opinion piece on my blog - The Occasional Human Sacrifice by Carl Elliott.
Beautifully written and unusual in focusing on psychological impact on whistleblowers.
http://deevybee.blogspot.com/2024/07/whistleblowing-research-misconduct-and.html

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: Our lab has been in this space for nearly 20 years. I helped design the space when the building was being constructed. Yet, I learned just now that there is a light under the kitchen cabinet.

item.title: Bob Jamieson
item.description: The Scottish Greens have said the next UK government must ensure train travel is cheaper than flying in a bid to cut emissions.The Greens are asking the next government to use taxation on aviation, including a flyer levy, in order to subsidise rail tickets on certain routes.https://news.stv.tv/politics/next-uk-government-must-make-trains-cheaper-than-flights-scottish-greens-say#ScottishGreens #TravelCosts #trains #transport #ClimateChange

item.title: Jan Rosenow
item.description: This is such a fun article! How a new generation of engineers push heat pumps to the efficiency limit. https://www.wired.com/story/heat-pump-maximum-efficiency/

item.title: Annemarie Bridy
item.description: I keep thinking about how 3 sitting SCOTUS justices were GOP operatives on the Bush team in FL back in 2000. Supreme Court is about to have 3 Bush v. Gore alumni sitting on the bench | CNN Politics https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/17/politics/bush-v-gore-barrett-kavanaugh-roberts-supreme-court/index.html
